00027 void IntensityReporter::setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc)
00028 {
00029   doc.setDocName(INTENSITYREPORTER);
00030   doc.setDocDescription("Class for dumping intensity values to a file.");
00031   doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00032 }

00034 /**
00035  * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00036  * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00037  * @return SelfDoc
00038  */
00039 SelfDoc IntensityReporter::explainSelf()
00040 {
00041   SelfDoc doc;
00042   setupSelfDoc(doc);
00043   return doc;
00044 }

00046 /**
00047  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00048  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00049  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00050  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00051  *
00052  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00053  *
00054  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00055  */
00056 SelfCreate * IntensityReporter::newObject(std::map<std::string, std::string> &param)
00057 {
00058   SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00059   std::string strFileName;
00060 
00061   fillInValue(strFileName, "file", param, doc);
00062   IntensityReporter* p = new IntensityReporter(strFileName);
00063   return p;
00064 }
00065 
00066 /**
00067 * Constructor
00068 *
00069 */
00070 IntensityReporter::IntensityReporter(const std::string& strFileName)
00071 {
00072   m_iCelFileCount = 0;
00073   if (strFileName == "") {
00074     throw(Except("No file specified for intensity reporter."));
00075   }
00076   m_strFileName = strFileName;
00077   m_Type = INTENSITYREPORTER;
00078   setupSelfDoc(*this);
00079 
00080   bool bFileExists =  Fs::fileExists(strFileName);
00081 
00082   // @todo I think this could be "affx::FILE5_OPEN||affx::FILE5_CREATE" -jhg
00083   m_file5.open(strFileName, (bFileExists ? affx::FILE5_REPLACE : affx::FILE5_CREATE));
00084   m_group5 = m_file5.openGroup("IntensityReporter", affx::FILE5_REPLACE);
00085   m_tsv5 = m_group5->openTsv("Parameters", affx::FILE5_REPLACE);
00086   m_tsv5->defineColumn(0, 0, "Parameter", affx::FILE5_DTYPE_STRING, 1024);
00087   m_tsv5->set_string(0, 0, "#%guid=" + affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid()); m_tsv5->writeLevel(0);
00088   m_tsv5->close();
00089   delete m_tsv5;
00090   m_tsv5 = m_group5->openTsv("Intensities", affx::FILE5_REPLACE);
00091 }
00092 
00093 /**
00094  * @brief destructor
00095  */
00096 IntensityReporter::~IntensityReporter()
00097 {
00098   m_tsv5->close();
00099   delete m_tsv5;
00100   m_group5->close();
00101   delete m_group5;
00102   m_file5.close();
00103 }

00110 /**
00111  * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00112  * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00113  */
00114 std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> IntensityReporter::getDefaultDocOptions()
00115 {
00116   std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00117   SelfDoc::Opt strFileName = {"file", SelfDoc::Opt::String, "", "", "NA", "NA",
00118                               "The name of the file to write the intensity values to"
00119                              };
00120   opts.push_back(strFileName);
00121   return opts;
00122 }

00124 /**
00125  * @brief Method for being passed a new cel file worth of data.
00126  * It simply counts the number of ceel files passed to the module.
00127  * @param data - Vector of vectors of cel file data from same sample.
00128  */
00129 /*  void newChip(std::vector<float> &data)  */
00130 /*  { */
00131 /*   m_iCelFileCount++;  */
00132 /*   chipStreamPassNewChip(data); */
00133 /*  } */
00134 
00135 /**
00136  * @brief Signal that no more data is coming (i.e. newChip() will
00137  * not be called anymore.
00138  * Define the columns for the HDF5 file.
00139  */
00140 void IntensityReporter::newDataSet(IntensityMart* iMart) {
00141   m_TransformedIMart = iMart;
00142   int dataset_count = m_TransformedIMart->getCelDataSetCount();
00143   std::vector<float> data;
00144   for (int d = 0; d < dataset_count; d++) {
00145     data = m_TransformedIMart->getCelData(d);
00146     assert(data.size() > 0);
00147     transform(d, data);
00148   }
00149   chipStreamPassNewChip(m_TransformedIMart);
00150 }
00151 
00152 void IntensityReporter::endChips()
00153 {
00154   m_tsv5->defineColumn(0, 0, "probeid", affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT);
00155   for (int iChipIndex = 0; (iChipIndex < m_iCelFileCount); iChipIndex++) {
00156     m_tsv5->defineColumn(0, (iChipIndex + 1), "Chip_" + ::getInt(iChipIndex + 1), affx::FILE5_DTYPE_FLOAT);
00157   }
00158   chipStreamEndChips();
00159 }
00160 
00161 /**
00162 * @brief transform the intensity point supplied coming from a particular
00163 * probe in a particular microarray.
00164 * Writes out the transformed intensities to the HDF5 file.
00165 *
00166 * @param iProbeIndex - Probe index from the cel file.
00167 * @param chipIx - Set of chip indexes from same sample.
00168 * @param intensity - Original intensities.
00169 * @param return - transformed intensities.
00170 */
00171 float IntensityReporter::transform(int iProbeIndex, int chipIx, float intensity)
00172 {
00173   /*    Verbose::out(1, "sample = " + ::getInt(chipIx[0]) + ", probe = " + ::getInt(iProbeId + 1)); */
00174 
00175   if (chipIx == 0) {
00176     m_tsv5->set_i(0, 0, (iProbeIndex + 1));
00177   }
00178   m_tsv5->set_f(0, (chipIx + 1), intensity);
00179   if ((chipIx + 1) == m_iCelFileCount) {
00180     m_tsv5->writeLevel(0);
00181   }
00182 
00183   return intensity;
00184 }
00185 
00186 void IntensityReporter::transform(int chipIx, std::vector<float>& intensity) {
00187   for (size_t probeIx = 0; probeIx < intensity.size(); probeIx++) {
00188     intensity[probeIx] = transform(probeIx, chipIx, intensity[probeIx]);
00189   }
00190 }
